recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Pepper Scallops is a simple and quick pan roasted dish where scallops are pan seared separately and served with capsicum / bell peppers. This is more of an International delicacy made with an Indian twist. It works great as a starter.

Scallops are a very good source for vitamin B12 that promotes cardiovascular health. It is also rich source of omega-3 fatty acids, potassium and magnesium which is also beneficial for cardiovascular health. It also helps in controlling blood pressure.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash scallops thoroughly with water and a pinch of turmeric. Pat try with tissue paper. You can cut scallops into desired shapes if required. Marinate scallops with above mentioned ingredients and keep it aside for minimum 1 hour.
Meanwhile, in a pan, heat oil. Add green chillies, garlic and curry leaves saute for a minute.
Add onions, fry on a low flame until color changes to brown.

Add coriander and turmeric powder, Saute for 30 secs. Then add capsicum and salt. Cover and cook on a medium flame for 5 mins, then reduce the flame to low and cook till capsicum becomes soft. Add fresh coriander leaves and fry for 30 secs. Once done, switch of the stove.
In a separate pan, heat 2 tbsp of oil, and saute scallops, 2 mins each side. Once done, serve immediately with above masala.

tips.tipDesc: Scallops if cooked for a long time becomes rubbery, so avoid over cooking. And it tastes best when eaten hot.
You can also chose to fry capsicum for a short time if you like it to be crispy.
